titleStmt.title: Letter, 12th United States House of Representatives to the Senate, 1812 April 9

publicationStmt.publisher: The University of Tennessee Libraries Digital Initiatives

availability.p: The copyright interests in this collection remain with the creator. For more information, contact the Special Collections Library.

bibl.title: Letter, 12th United States House of Representatives to the Senate, 1812 April 9
bibl.note: Greer and Vinsinger Family Collection of American Revolutionary War Documents
This letter, marked confidential, informs the Senate of a bill that was passed to prohibit the exportation of species, goods, wares, and merchandise for a limited time.

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for The University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Corrections have been applied to the text only where there is a high degree of certainty of an error and if the correct spelling is known.
Corrections are represented by editorial tags.
Quotation marks and apostrophes have been replaced by entity references.
All unambiguous end-of-line hyphens have been removed.
Names of persons, places, and organizations are indicated in the transcription when identifiable with a high degree of certainty.

keywords.term: Lafayette, Marie Joseph Paul Yves Roch Gilbert Du Motier, marquis de, 1757-1834

revisionDesc.change: Reformatted transcription from its original TEI.2 markup to comply with the TEI-P5 lite schema.

Added "idno" element, editorial declaration statement, subjects/keywords and abstracts from EAD finding aid. Removed box and folder notes, reference declaration element. Changed the formatting for blank pages. Added resp attributes to editorial changes, and added name tags.

div.p: An engrossed Bill to prohibit the exportation of specie, goods, wares and merchandise for alimited time was read the third time was read the third time
And on the Question that the same do pass?
It was resolved in the Affirmative: } yeas 69
The yeahs and nays being demanded by one fifth of the numbers present
Those who have voted in the affirmativeare }
Those who have voted in the negative } See A.
Ordered that the title be "An act to prohibit the exportation of specie, good, wares and merchandize for a limited time."

Mr Smilie and Mr Pleasants were appointed a Committee
to carry the said bill to the Senate, and to inform them that the House of Representatives have passed the same under an injunction of secrecy, and to desire their concurrence in the said bill
